result.execSummary:
The defendant Kurt L. Lobacz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(>10-50g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)3.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If stayed sentence is imposed the defendant has 35 days credit for time served.
Concurrent with: Imposed sentence on cases 16CF124 and 16CF48

The conditions of Extended Supervision are the same as the conditions of probation on this same case.
Concurrent with: Imposed sentences on cases 16CF48 and 16CF124
Concurrent with: Probation on cases 16CF124 and 16CF48

miscConds.notes: Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.

Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises, exception for in the scope of his work, but to maintain absolute sobriety.   Defendant shall not be in the presence or possession of drugs or drug paraphernalia, or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a licensed Wisconsin medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.   Defendant shall only use one pharmacy for his prescriptions.  The defendant is not to associate with any know drug dealers or users.
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.
The defendant is to submit to an Alcohol and Other Drug Assessment (AODA) and follow the recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent.

timeConds.notes:
Defendant was granted 365 days credit for time served.
Concurrent with: Jail sentence in cases 16CF124 and 16CF48

The defendant shall have no contact with M.S  or M.L. of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way. Defendant shall not possess or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.    The defendant shall not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons as defined under Wisconsin law. Exception defendant may go through a third party no more than 3 times a week to make arrangements for child placement/visitation.
AMENDED 04/03/2017.  The defendant may have written communication with M.L.
